intro: Thesium bundiense, commonly known as the Bundi thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their showy inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish to orange flowers. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Thesium bundiense is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
